com.mousebird.maply

Class OSMVectorTilePager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.OSMVectorTilePager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface

    public class OSMVectorTilePager
extends java.lang.Object
implements QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface
    The OSM Vector Tile Pager reads vector tiles from a remote source, probably the US OpenStreetMap server, and displays them on the screen as the user moves around.

    This is an example implementation of the QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface for OSM vector tiles.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OSMVectorTilePager

        public OSMVectorTilePager(MaplyBaseController inMaplyControl,
                  java.lang.String inRemotePath,
                  int inMinZoom,
                  int inMaxZoom,
                  int numThreads)
        Construct with the data we need to start.
        Parameters:
        inMaplyControl - The control we'll add geometry to as we go.
        inRemotePath - The remote path to the vector tiles.
        inMinZoom - Minimum zoom level to start at. Normally 0, but you can cut off levels.
        inMaxZoom - The maximum zoom level to zoom into.
        numThreads - Number of threads we're allowed to use in the process of fetching data.

      • startFetchForTile

        public void startFetchForTile(QuadPagingLayer layer,
                     MaplyTileID tileID)
        Description copied from interface: QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface
        The paging layer calls your class hear to start fetching a tile. We're assuming you're making network calls and it might take a while, so DO NOT BLOCK here. Instead, kick off your network calls and deal with the data when it comes back.

        Calls into the QuadPagingLayer are thread safe, so do your real work on your own thread, or use the LayerThread if you need to.

        When your data comes in you should create the visual objects you want in the maply controller and then call addData() one or more times with your new ComponentObject's. Those visual objects should start out with enable = false.

        Once you've loaded data, call tileDidLoad() or if you've failed call tileFailedToLoad(). The paging layer will only have a few loads outstanding at once, so you must tell it to continue loading, even on a failure.

        Specified by:
        startFetchForTile in interface QuadPagingLayer.PagingInterface
        Parameters:
        layer - The quad paging layer asking you to start fetching.
        tileID - The tile to start fetching
